definition:
The set of all $n\!\times\!n$ matrices over a skew field forms an
$n^2$-dimensional associative algebra, for the basis of which one can
take the *basal units*. A basal unit of the algebra has all components
zeroes except only one which is 1.\
E.g. $$\begin{pmatrix}
0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1 \\
0 & 0 & 0 
\end{pmatrix}$$ is a basal unit of the algebra of $3\!\times\!3$
matrices.

New York (1923; second edition 1960).
